title: 110_s2677
content: The "Supporting Education for Returning Veterans Act of 2008" establishes a grant program to support veterans at institutions of higher education. This program is added as Part F to Title VII of the Higher Education Act of 1965. The Secretary is authorized to award grants to institutions of higher education to establish programs supporting veterans by addressing their academic, financial, physical, and social needs. Grants are awarded for a 3-year period, and institutions must submit an application for approval by the Secretary. The Secretary approves or disapproves applications from institutions of higher education for grants to support veteran students based on enrollment numbers, veteran needs, sustainability of programs, and equitable distribution of grants. Each institution of higher education receiving a grant under this section must establish a program to support veteran students by addressing their academic, financial, physical, and social needs through a Center of Excellence. The grants aim for equitable distribution among rural and urban areas. Establishing a Center of Excellence for Veteran Student Success at the institution of higher education to provide comprehensive support services for veteran students, including admissions, registration, financial aid, veterans benefits, academic advising, student health, counseling, career advising, and disabilities services. The program established at an institution of higher education for veteran students may include a support team, a coordinator, and monitoring of enrollment and completion rates. Optional activities may also be provided for veteran students. The program at an institution for veteran students may include outreach, counseling, tutoring, financial aid assistance, housing support, and specialized classes for veterans. The program at an institution for veteran students includes activities to ease their transition to campus life, support for veteran student organizations, coordination of academic advising with military bases, and other necessary support services to ensure their success in achieving educational and career goals. The Secretary will develop an evaluation and accountability plan for these programs. The Secretary will develop an evaluation and accountability plan for programs at institutions of higher education for veterans to measure the impact on enrollment, persistence, and completion rates.
